title: President and CEO

name: Clair, Pierson E. III
title: President and CEO
notes: Born May 6, 1948 in Pasadena, CA. Stanford BA in political science (1970). Built a 50-year confectionery career, becoming CEO of Brown & Haley (maker of Almond Roca) in 2003, stepping down in 2022. Inducted into the Candy Hall of Fame.

name: Decker, Richard W. Jr.
title: Chairman / Founder
notes: Long Beach State BS (1967), MBA (1969), Thunderbird graduate degree (1970). Built career at Chemical Bank and First Interstate Bank of California (EVP/CAO), then was President/CEO of WestAmerica Bank before founding Belvedere Capital in 1994. Served on the Board of Directors of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco.
ngos: Board of Directors, Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco

name: Konkel, Harry W.
title: Captain, USN (Ret.)
notes: Born July 11, 1935 in Jackson, WY; died January 6, 2024 in Portland, ME. Naval Academy BS (1958), Naval Postgraduate School BSEE (1965), Naval War College MA (1974). Career naval officer retiring as Captain in 1985 after commanding two destroyers and a destroyer tender. Member of the Bohemian Club and active in civic organizations.
ngos: Navy League United States (National Director 1989-1997); Gunston School (trustee); Gould Academy (trustee); Humane Society Hancock County (director)

name: Matthews, Christopher J.
title: Political Commentator / Host
notes: Christopher Matthews is the political journalist and former MSNBC host (Hardball), and former top aide to House Speaker Tip O'Neill. He has been listed among Bohemian Grove attendees. Note: leaked lists place him in Owl's Nest camp rather than Parsonage; assignment here follows the source list provided.

name: McKannay, Richard H. Jr.
title: Managing Director / Owner
notes: University of Santa Clara BS and Thunderbird (American Institute of Foreign Trade) graduate. Army veteran. Based in San Francisco, runs ISOFLEX USA, an isotopes and specialty chemicals import/export firm. Previously associated with Mission Capital Funding.

name: McNeil, Dennis A.
title: President
notes: President of Trident Property Management, a property management firm based in Yuba City, California, operating in Yuba, Sutter, Butte, Sacramento, and Placer Counties.

name: Poole, Edward Gray
employer: Anderson, Donovan & Poole, A.P.C. (now Anderson & Poole)
title: Attorney / Partner
notes: Born March 26, 1960 in Palo Alto, CA. Bowdoin College BA (1982), University of Pacific McGeorge School of Law JD (admitted to bar 1985). San Francisco attorney specializing in energy law, transportation law, estate planning and probate. Member of multiple professional bar associations.
ngos: Conference of California Public Utility Counsel; Association of Transportation Law Professionals

name: Schilling, Alexander H. Jr.
employer: Union Square Investment Company (family investment firm)
title: President
notes: Son of Alexander H. 'Mike' Schilling (born SF 1929), who joined Ampex in 1958 before taking over a family investment company. Alexander Jr. ('Andy') inherited leadership of the family investment vehicle. The Schilling family has deep roots in San Francisco.

name: Schnabel, Rockwell A.
title: Co-founder / Advisory Director; Chairman
notes: Born December 30, 1936 in Amsterdam. Naturalized U.S. citizen. Co-founded Trident Capital investment firm in 1993. Served as U.S. Ambassador to Finland under Reagan (1986-1989), Deputy Secretary of Commerce under George H.W. Bush (1991-1993), and U.S. Ambassador to the European Union under George W. Bush (2001-2005). Currently Chairman of The Sage Group LLC.
political_donations: Major Republican donor; bundler for Reagan and Bush administrations

name: Seligmann, Peter
title: Co-founder / Chairman Emeritus
notes: Born September 30, 1950. Rutgers BS in Wildlife Ecology; Yale MS in Forestry and Environmental Science. Co-founded Conservation International in 1987, serving as CEO until 2017 and as board chair until June 2025. Co-founded Nia Tero in 2017. Now Chairman of Silvania natural capital fund and Distinguished Professor of Practice at Arizona State University.
ngos: Conservation International (co-founder, Chairman Emeritus); Nia Tero (co-founder); Americares (board); Institute for Integrative Conservation at William & Mary (advisory council); William & Mary

name: Smyth, John E.
employer: First Republic Investment Management (reported); First California Funding
title: Executive / Owner
notes: A John Smyth is associated with First Republic Investment Management at 111 Pine St, San Francisco and also with First California Funding as Owner. No definitive biographical details confirmed for the specific Parsonage camp member.

name: Spencer, David Hooker
title: Founder / Entrepreneur
notes: Born December 1, 1961. Grandson of John D. Rockefeller III. Stanford GSB MBA; Claremont McKenna College BA in political science. Founded BayKids (nonprofit teaching filmmaking to seriously ill children), worked in community outreach for Oakland A's and SF Giants, and founded SenSpa wellness center in the Presidio. Elected Chair of the Board of Trustees of the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco in 2025.
ngos: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco (Board Chair, 2025); San Francisco Ballet (Board of Directors); Commonwealth Club; Creativity Explored

name: Taylor, Vernon III
title: Chief Executive Officer
notes: Born September 20, 1947 in New York City. Stanford BS (1970). Served as CEO of Chemex Pharmaceuticals (Englewood, CO) and Geodome Resources (Vancouver, BC), both 1979-1989. Also served on boards of Placer Dome Inc., CoCa Mines Inc., and Bradmar Petroleum. Grew up on his family's 122-acre estate in Colorado.

name: Thomas, Arthur Norman
title: Professor of Surgery / Chief of Thoracic Surgery (SFGH)
notes: Born January 27, 1931 in San Mateo, CA; died June 29, 2025 at age 94. Chose surgery at age 13. Served as Chief of Thoracic Surgery at San Francisco General Hospital and Professor of Surgery at UCSF for decades. Published over 125 scientific articles; co-founded the Samson Thoracic Surgical Society (later Western Thoracic Surgical Association) in 1974. Pioneer in hyperbaric medicine.

name: Thompson, Charles Glenn
title: Unknown
notes: No definitive biographical match found for Charles Glenn Thompson in the Parsonage camp. Multiple California attorneys named Charles Thompson exist but none confirmed as this specific member.

name: Thompson, Robert Badcon
title: Unknown
notes: No biographical information found for Robert Badcon Thompson. The middle name 'Badcon' is unusual and did not surface in any public database searches.

name: Tooley, William L.
title: Chairman / Founder
notes: Born April 23, 1934 in El Paso, TX; died September 20, 2025 in Sun Valley, ID at age 91. Founded Tooley & Company in 1975, developing millions of square feet of premier office space across Los Angeles, Santa Monica, Orange County, and San Francisco. Earlier co-founded Ketchum, Peck & Tooley. Received Lifetime Achievement Award from LA Area Chamber of Commerce (1992).
ngos: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco (director); Central City Association (director); Loyola Marymount University (regent); Notre Dame High School (director)

name: Walker, Brooks III
title: Founding Partner
notes: Son of Brooks Walker Jr. (1928-2024), who was president and chairman of United States Leasing International. Brooks Walker III is a San Francisco architect and philanthropist who founded Walker/Warner Architects specializing in residential architecture. University of Oregon BArch (1983). Active in conservation and arts organizations.
ngos: Wild Salmon Center (board); Ploughshares Fund (board/investment committee); SPUR; Aim High Academy (board, former); Walker Art Center (board, former); SFMOMA (former)

name: Wallis, Edward James
title: Founder / Owner
notes: UC graduate and former Napa Valley real estate developer. Purchased 85-acre property in Calistoga on Diamond Mountain Road in 1975. Planted vines in 1997 and founded Wallis Family Estate winery in 2006, producing under 1,000 cases annually of Cabernet Sauvignon. The estate's stone castle (built 1906) is on the National Register of Historic Places.

name: Alexander, Matthew D.
title: Unknown
notes: No definitive biographical match found for Matthew D. Alexander in the Poison Oak camp. Multiple California businessmen named Matthew Alexander exist but none confirmed as this specific member.

name: Arnold, Carl D. III
title: Vistage Chair / Former CEO
notes: University of Denver BS in Business Administration (Hotel/Restaurant Management). As Chairman, CEO, and owner of Milepost Industries and Arnold Hotel Group, built businesses to $100M in annualized revenues over 18 years before selling. Now a Vistage Chair and executive coach in San Francisco. Holds AIF designation and Series 7/66/31 licenses.

name: Bell, Bradley
title: Executive Producer and Head Writer, The Bold and the Beautiful
notes: Born June 29, 1964 in Chicago. Son of daytime TV creators Lee Phillip Bell and William J. Bell. UCLA education. Co-founded Bell-Phillip Television in 1987 with parents. Head writer since 1993 and executive producer since 1995 of The Bold and the Beautiful. Winner of 16 Emmy Awards. Lives in Holmby Hills, Los Angeles.

name: Bloomingdale, Robert R.
title: Film Producer
notes: Born 1954. Son of Alfred S. Bloomingdale (Diners Club chairman, 'father of the credit card') and socialite Betsy Bloomingdale, who was a close friend of Nancy Reagan. Produced films including Captain Nuke and the Bomber Boys (1996). Member of prominent California socialite family.

name: Boone, Philip S. Jr.
title: Attorney / Of Counsel
notes: UC Berkeley BA; UC Hastings JD. Business, banking, and securities lawyer in San Francisco for over 30 years. Pre-practice roles included staff on the Judiciary Committee during Nixon's Impeachment Inquiry (1973-74) and the Federal Reserve Board's Consumer Affairs Division. Vice Chancellor of the Episcopal Diocese of California and President of the Henry W. Sabin Scholarship Fund.
ngos: Episcopal Diocese of California (Vice Chancellor); Henry W. Sabin Scholarship Fund (President)

name: Boring, Dix
title: Attorney (retired)
notes: Born June 8, 1932 in Chico, CA; died March 16, 2024 at age 91. Attended UC Berkeley in 1950, then law school. In 1961 co-founded the law firm Knecht, Dingus, Fink and Boring. His sons Douglas and David Rolph survived him. Father of Douglas Boring (Poison Oak camp).

name: Boring, Douglas
title: Managing Partner and Senior Wealth Advisor
notes: Son of Dix Boring (Poison Oak camp). UC Berkeley BA; played rugby for Cal's national championship team. CFP and CKA designations. Financial professional since 1995 in Roseville, California. Former founding partner of Spectrum Wealth Management. Specializes in retirement planning and estate planning.

name: Burmeister, Robert N.
employer: Law Offices of Robert N. Burmeister
title: Attorney / Owner
notes: California attorney based in Redwood City with 49 years of experience. UC Hastings law degree (1977). General practice attorney; practice areas include immigration law, naturalization, and investor visas. Robert N. Burmeister Sr. (born 1922) was also a San Francisco resident who served in WWII.

name: Cahill, William R.
title: Retired Judge / Neutral (Mediator and Arbitrator)
notes: Retired San Francisco Superior Court judge who joined JAMS after stepping down from the bench in 2000. Served as SF Superior Court Law & Motion Judge for 4 years and Settlement and Trial Judge for 8 years. Named one of the 500 Leading Judges in America by Lawdragon (2006) and recognized as a top Bay Area neutral multiple years.

name: Cashin, John
title: Principal, Commercial Real Estate
notes: Over 20 years in commercial real estate in the San Francisco Bay Area. Joined Avison Young in April 2012 as part of the team that opened its first Bay Area office. Previously VP at Cornish & Carey Commercial/Newmark Knight Frank (consistent top-5 producer). University of Oregon BA in Sociology. Appointed Market Leader for Avison Young's Palo Alto office.

name: Davey, Craig S.
title: Financial Advisor
notes: Walnut Creek, California-based financial professional with Diablo Wealth Management LLC. No additional detailed public biography confirmed.

name: Donner, Alexander B.
title: Unknown

name: Ducommun, Robert C.
title: Board Member (Independent Director)
notes: Fourth-generation Californian. Stanford BA in History (1973); Harvard Business School MBA (1978). Great-great-grandson of Charles Ducommun who founded California's oldest company in Los Angeles in 1849. Served as Independent Director at Ducommun (NYSE: DCO) from 1985 to 2025. Based in New York City.
ngos: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (trustee); Episcopal School, NYC (trustee); St. George's School (trustee, former treasurer)

name: Dunlap, Larry

name: Hale, James C. III
employer: FTV Capital / Bank of Marin Bancorp (NASDAQ: BMRC)
title: Co-founder/Managing General Partner (FTV Capital); Board Chair (Bank of Marin)
notes: Born February 9, 1952 in San Francisco. UC Berkeley BS in Finance & Accounting; Harvard MBA; CPA. 16 years at BancAmerica Securities as Senior Managing Partner. Co-founded FTV Capital in 1998, a fintech-focused venture and private equity firm. Appointed to Bank of Marin board in 2014 and elected Board Chair in 2025. Also director of ACI Worldwide (NASDAQ: ACIW) and Mitek Systems (NASDAQ: MITK).

name: Hebert, Bradford V.
title: Attorney
notes: San Francisco Bay Area real estate attorney with over 20 years of experience. Practices with Berliner Cohen LLP in Northern California. No additional detailed public biography confirmed.

name: Honeyman, David E. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: An obituary for David August Honeyman Jr. (died September 3, 2017) exists from Sacramento, CA. No additional detailed professional biography confirmed for the Poison Oak camp member.

name: Jason, William G.
title: Owner / President
notes: Born January 6, 1926 in Portland, OR; died December 30, 2011 in Atherton, CA at age 85. Stanford BA (1948), WWII naval officer. Owned and operated Bemiss-Jason Corporation (paper and educational products), sold in late 1990s. Polo player for over 50 years; Ambassador to the Federation of International Polo; Board member, U.S. Polo Association; founding member, Eldorado Polo Club.
ngos: Federation of International Polo (Ambassador); United States Polo Association (Board member); Menlo Circus Club (polo); Eldorado Polo Club (founding member)

title: Former President (Owl Securities); President (Kingsley Associates)
notes: Was previously President of Owl Securities & Investments, Ltd. (Nevada-incorporated, now inactive). Also listed as President at Kingsley Associates, a California-based real estate research and advisory firm. UC Berkeley BA in Business Communication with Sociology minor.

name: Kuhn, Jeffrey S.
title: Managing Partner (retired); Town Treasurer
notes: Fifth-generation Californian from San Francisco. UC Davis BA in Economics. Investment banking career started at Kidder, Peabody & Co. in 1975, later co-headed Kidder's private equity desk. Subsequently CFO for multiple Silicon Valley technology companies. Co-founded FLG Partners in 2004 (fractional CFO services firm). Retired from FLG in early 2022. Serves as Town Treasurer of Ross, CA.

employer: Sotheby's International Realty / The Moore Group
title: Sales Associate and Global Real Estate Advisor
notes: Lifelong third-generation native San Franciscan from Presidio Heights. Saint Ignatius College Preparatory, University of Santa Clara, and Menlo College School of Business. In real estate since 1987; co-founded Ritchie-Hallanan Real Estate. Consistently among top 2% of San Francisco agents.
ngos: San Francisco Boys & Girls Club (board); Salvation Army Advisory Board; The Guardsmen (director; President 1994)

name: Rollandi, Victor Lawrence Sr.
title: Founder, President and CEO
notes: Born in San Francisco. U.S. Navy career 1973-2003, retiring as Captain. Founded SDV Services, Inc. in Alameda, CA in 2005, a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business specializing in construction, steel and rigging, and fuel services, including nuclear heavy lift. Attended St. Ignatius College Preparatory.
ngos: World Presidents' Organization (WPO) Northern California Chapter (Chapter Chairman 2009-10)

name: Stephens, Lane
title: President
notes: Born May 1975. UC Berkeley BA in History. Industrial property broker at Colliers International 1998-2000, then joined D. R. Stephens & Company in 2001. Now leads one of the San Francisco Bay Area's larger industrial property owners, with investments worth over $500 million across northern California.
ngos: Urban Land Institute (board, local chapter National Association of Industrial and Office Properties)

name: Stewart, John W.

name: Walker, Vaughn
title: Principal (Retired Federal Judge)
notes: University of Michigan BA (1966); Stanford Law JD (1970); Woodrow Wilson Fellow at UC Berkeley (1966-67). U.S. District Court Judge, Northern District of California (1990-2011); Chief Judge (2004-2010). Ruled California's Proposition 8 unconstitutional (Hollingsworth v. Perry, 2010). Now principal at Walker Nakamura ADR in San Francisco focusing on arbitration, mediation, and litigation consulting. Taught at UC Berkeley, Stanford, and UC Hastings law schools.
ngos: American Law Institute (member); St Francis Foundation (former chair)

name: Warren, Jeffrey Earl
employer: Jeffrey Earl Warren Team / Golden Gate Sotheby's International Realty
title: President / Real Estate Broker
notes: Grandson of California Governor and U.S. Supreme Court Chief Justice Earl Warren. UC Berkeley graduate. Spent 15 years in advertising as VP-Creative Director at J. Walter Thompson (NYC) and SVP at Foote, Cone & Belding (SF). Since 1986 has specialized in Napa Valley vineyard and winery real estate. Former President of James Warren & Son (1960-2014), the leading winery real estate office in Napa Valley.
